newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU summit warns Belgrade over rights.
newsitem.headline: EU summit warns Belgrade over rights.

text.p: The European Union warned rump Yugoslavia on Tuesday to respect human rights and build democracy or risk damaging its links with the 15-nation bloc.
In a declaration issued at the EU's mid-year summit in Amsterdam, EU leaders said Belgrade also had to grant "a large degree of autonomy" to ethic Albanian Kosovo.
"The European Council shares the concern of the international community at the slow progress towards genuine democracy and respect for fundamental rights and freedoms," the declaration said.
The leaders also warned Croatia that respect for human rights, including the return of displaced persons and refugges, was an essential ingredient in improving relations between the EU and Zagreb.
On Bosnia-Herzegovina, they said they were concerned at the slow progress in the consolidation of the two entities into a single state as called for in the Dayton peace agreement.
